lead_paragraph: Figuring out how to make fire was no doubt an evolutionary boon to our ancestors. But it may have led to our smoking habit and the emergence of tuberculosis.

headline.print_headline: The Lingering Embers of Discovering Fire

snippet: Figuring out how to make fire was no doubt an evolutionary boon to our ancestors. But it may have led to our smoking habit and the emergence of tuberculosis....
abstract: Studies in journals Molecular Biology and Evolution and Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences examine positive and negative effects of human discovery of fire; findings suggest exposure to smoke may have prompted mutation allowing humans to withstand certain toxins, but may have also weakened lungs and allowed spread of tuberculosis.
